questions.question: I ………………………. of visiting America.
questions.description: When think means ‘consider the idea of’, it is normally used in the continuous form.

questions.question: He ………………………. ill since last week.
questions.description: Perfect tenses are used with the time expressions since and for.

questions.question: My dog is very silly he …………………………… after cats.
questions.description: The simple present tense is used for a habitual action. The present continuous can also be used to talk about a particularly obstinate habit.

questions.question: The steamer ………………………… yesterday.
questions.description: To state that something happened sometime ago we use the simple past tense.

questions.question: We ……………………….. anything from them for months.
questions.description: Perfect tenses are preferred with the time expressions since and for.

questions.question: I phoned her because I ……………………….. to talk.
questions.description: Some verbs are never or hardly ever used in progressive forms. Want is one of them.

questions.question: I ……………………….. his parents tomorrow.
questions.description: The present continuous is used here to indicate that the arrangement already exists.

questions.question: ………………………….. in ghosts?
questions.description: Believe is one of those verbs that are not normally used in the continuous form.

questions.question: I didn’t know how long she ………………………….. there.
questions.description: The past perfect continuous tense is used to talk about an activity that had been going on around a past time.

questions.question: The Rhine ……………………. into the North Sea.
questions.description: We use the simple present tense here because we are talking about a permanent situation.

questions.question: When I reached home I noticed that water ……………………… down the wall.
questions.description: We use the past continuous tense here to indicate that the situation was ongoing and temporary.

questions.question: ……………………… her tastes, I sent her some flowers.
questions.description: Although the verb know is not normally used in progressive tenses, it does have an –ing form which can be used in other kinds of structures.
